intro: Hieracium aranigena, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are hairy and have a serrated edge, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium aranigena is often found in temperate climates and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
